required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A 10-Week, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Pregabalin (150 mg - 600 mg/Day) Using a Flexible, Optimized Dose Schedule in Subjects With Peripheral Neuropathic Pain

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy of pregabalin, using a flexible, optimized dose schedule with dose adjustment based on Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS), compared to placebo in subjects with peripheral neuropathic pain.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Mean Pain Score (ITT Population)

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Number of 30% Responders (With Respect to Pain Scores)
Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Number of 50% Responders (With Respect to Pain Scores)
Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Weekly Mean Pain Score
Duration Adjusted Average Change (DAAC) of (Adjusted) Mean Pain Score
Mean Sleep Interference Score Based on Daily Sleep Interference Scale (DSIS).
Mean Sleep Score as Computed by DSIS.
Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Disturbance
Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Snoring Score
Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Awaken Short of Breath or Headache
Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Quantity
Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Optimal Sleep: Number of Participants With Optimal Sleep
Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Adequacy
Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Somnolence
Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Overall Sleep Problems Index
Euro Quality of Life (QOL) (EQ-5D) Utility Score
Euro Quality of Life (EQ-5D) Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale- Anxiety (HADS-A) Score
Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale- Depression (HADS-D) Score
Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC)
Duration Adjusted Average Change (DAAC) of (Unadjusted) Mean Pain Score

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of peripheral neuropathic pain syndrome, including diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN), postherpetic neuralgia (PHN), or post-traumatic neuropathic pain (including post-surgical), confirmed by a qualified pain specialist.
- Subjects must have completed at least 4 daily pain diaries during the 7 days prior to Visit 2 and have an average pain score of ≥4 over the 7 days prior to Visit 2 (randomization).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neurologic disorders unrelated to DPN, PHN, or post-traumatic neuropathic pain (including post-surgical), that may confuse or confound the assessment of neuropathic pain.
- Presence of any severe pain associated with conditions other than DPN, PHN, or post-traumatic neuropathic pain (including post-surgical) that may confound the assessment or self evaluation of the pain due to DPN, PHN, or post-traumatic neuropathic pain (including post-surgical).
- Creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min (estimated from serum creatinine, body weight, age, and sex using the Cockcroft and Gault equation in Appendix E). Maximum dose for subjects with creatinine clearance of 30 to 60 mL/min is 300 mg/day

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study Initiation and Completion Dates: 27 December 2005 to 28 December 2007; 10 study centers in Korea
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 241 subjects were assigned to study treatment; one subject was randomized but did not receive any study treatment with the reason ‘Did not meet entrance criteria’.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender

outcome.title: Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Number of 30% Responders (With Respect to Pain Scores)
outcome.description: DPRS consists of an 11-point rating scale ranging from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). A 30% responder at endpoint is a subject who has a 30% or more reduction in mean pain score at endpoint compared to baseline
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. For subjects who did not complete the study, the last 7 available daily pain scores while on study medication were carried forward (LOCF) to calculate the endpoint mean score.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Number of 30% Responders (With Respect to Pain Scores)
measure.description: DPRS consists of an 11-point rating scale ranging from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). A 30% responder at endpoint is a subject who has a 30% or more reduction in mean pain score at endpoint compared to baseline
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. For subjects who did not complete the study, the last 7 available daily pain scores while on study medication were carried forward (LOCF) to calculate the endpoint mean score.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis of no treatment difference in each of the centers.
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: P-value in above table was from Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel test comparing Pregabalin and Placebo adjusted for center.
analysis.estimate_desc: RR estimates relative responder rate between Pregabalin and Placebo (the ratio of the former responder rate to the latter). Estimated RR was center-adjusted ie, assumed common RR in all centers, then a weighted average of center specific RRs computed

outcome.title: Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Mean Pain Score (ITT Population)
outcome.description: DPRS is 11-point rating scale from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). Subjects instructed to describe their pain (daily upon awakening) during preceding 24 hrs by choosing the appropriate number between 0-10. Mean endpoint pain score was obtained from the last 7 available DPRS scores of the daily pain diary while subject on study medication.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. For subjects who did not complete the study, the last 7 available daily pain scores while on study medication were carried forward (LOCF) to calculate the endpoint mean score.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Mean Pain Score (ITT Population)
measure.description: DPRS is 11-point rating scale from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). Subjects instructed to describe their pain (daily upon awakening) during preceding 24 hrs by choosing the appropriate number between 0-10. Mean endpoint pain score was obtained from the last 7 available DPRS scores of the daily pain diary while subject on study medication.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. For subjects who did not complete the study, the last 7 available daily pain scores while on study medication were carried forward (LOCF) to calculate the endpoint mean score.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypotheses stated there was no difference in pregabalin and placebo in the primary endpoint versus the alternative that there was. The target sample size was 234 subjects (156 and 78 respectively pregabalin vs placebo using a 2:1 ratio). The calculations assumed a 2-sided comparison at 0.05 alpha, 80% power and 3% dropout. Also, a treatment difference of 1 point and a standard deviation for endpoint mean pain scores of 2.5 were assumed based on previous studies.
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from the general linear model with treatment and center fitted as factors and the baseline value as a covariate.

analysis.groups_desc: This was a supportive analysis of the primary endpoint to determine if the main results were generalizable across centers.
analysis.p_value_desc: Interaction p-value based on adding interaction term to the main model.
analysis.method_desc: In supportive model 1, a “treatment by center” independent variable added to the main model.

analysis.groups_desc: This was a supportive analysis of the primary endpoint to determine if the main results were generalizable across different baseline values.
analysis.p_value_desc: Interaction p-value based on adding interaction term to the main model.
analysis.method_desc: In supportive model 2, a “treatment by baseline mean pain” independent variable added to the main model.

outcome.title: Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Mean Pain Scores (Evaluable Population)
outcome.description: DPRS is 11-point rating scale from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). Subjects instructed to describe their pain (daily upon awakening) during preceding 24 hrs by choosing the appropriate number between 0-10. Mean endpoint pain score was obtained from the last 7 available DPRS scores of the daily pain diary while subject on study medication.
outcome.population: Evaluable (EVAL) Population: Subset of ITT subjects with ≥4 daily pain diaries in the 7 days before Visit 2 (randomization) with average score ≥4; ≥14 days of treatment; ≥14 days of DB daily pain diaries; not withdrawn due to "Protocol violation" or "Did not meet entrance criteria"; not previously participated in the study.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

analysis.groups_desc: Endpoint Mean Pain Score Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center fitted as factors and the baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Weekly Mean Pain Score
outcome.description: DPRS is 11-point rating scale (0=no pain to 10=worst possible pain). Subjects instructed to describe pain (upon awakening) during preceding 24 hrs by choosing appropriate number between 0-10. Mean endpoint pain score obtained from last 7 available DPRS scores of daily pain diary while subject on study medication. Overall Comparison=8-week average.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. Missing Weekly mean scores were not imputed. Number of subjects analyzed differed by week; noted as n= (pregabalin, placebo).

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

measure.title: Daily Pain Rating Scale (DPRS)- Weekly Mean Pain Score
measure.description: DPRS is 11-point rating scale (0=no pain to 10=worst possible pain). Subjects instructed to describe pain (upon awakening) during preceding 24 hrs by choosing appropriate number between 0-10. Mean endpoint pain score obtained from last 7 available DPRS scores of daily pain diary while subject on study medication. Overall Comparison=8-week average.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. Missing Weekly mean scores were not imputed. Number of subjects analyzed differed by week; noted as n= (pregabalin, placebo).

analysis.groups_desc: Mean Pain Score Weeks 1 to 8 Overall Comparison (8-week average) Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from a linear mixed model with treatment, week, center, and treatment by week interaction as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Duration Adjusted Average Change (DAAC) of (Adjusted) Mean Pain Score
outcome.description: DAAC is a score used to assess treatment effects averaged over the entire length of the study. DAAC from baseline to weekly mean pain score was derived by calculating the mean of all post-baseline scores minus baseline mean pain score, and then weighing this according to the proportion of the planned study duration the subject actually completed.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. Subjects without any post-baseline daily pain scores would have no DAAC; missing DAACs were not imputed.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

analysis.groups_desc: Duration Adjusted Average Change (DAAC) Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Mean Sleep Interference Score Based on Daily Sleep Interference Scale (DSIS).
outcome.description: DSIS consists of an 11-point rating scale (0 = pain did not interfere with sleep to 10 = completely interfered with sleep). Higher score indicating greater level of sleep disturbance.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. For subjects who did not complete the study, the last 7 available daily sleep interference scores while on study medication were carried forward (LOCF) to calculate the endpoint mean score.

outcome.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Disturbance
outcome.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Sleep Disturbance sub-scale scores range from 0 to 100, lower scores indicate less disturbance.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

analysis.groups_desc: Week 8 Snoring Score Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Awaken Short of Breath or Headache
outcome.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Awaken Short of Breath or with a Headache sub-scale scores range from 0 to 100, lower scores indicate less difficulty.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Awaken Short of Breath or Headache
measure.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Awaken Short of Breath or with a Headache sub-scale scores range from 0 to 100, lower scores indicate less difficulty.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Week 8 Awaken Short of Breath or Headache Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Quantity
outcome.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Sleep Quantity sub-scale scores range from 0 to 24 (number of hours slept).
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Quantity
measure.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Sleep Quantity sub-scale scores range from 0 to 24 (number of hours slept).
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Week 8 Sleep Quantity Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Optimal Sleep: Number of Participants With Optimal Sleep
outcome.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Optimal Sleep sub-scale score is a binary outcome derived from Sleep Quantity (SQ): the response is YES (or 1) if SQ = 7 or 8 hours per night.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Optimal Sleep: Number of Participants With Optimal Sleep
measure.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Optimal Sleep sub-scale score is a binary outcome derived from Sleep Quantity (SQ): the response is YES (or 1) if SQ = 7 or 8 hours per night.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Week 8 Optimal Sleep Optimal Sleep is a binary outcome derived from Sleep Quantity (SQ): the response is YES (or 1) if SQ = 7 or 8 hours per night. Odds ratio measured the odds of optimal sleep in pregabalin to that in placebo. "Standard Error of the Mean" equals "Standard Error of the Odds Ratio (OR)".
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: OR estimated from model with Optimal sleep status (Yes/No) as response variable, and treatment, baseline Optimal sleep status as explanatory variables
analysis.estimate_desc: The OR estimates ratio of “Odds of optimal sleep” between Pregabalin and Placebo (ie, the former to the latter). “Odds of optimal sleep” in treatment group is ratio of “Probability of having optimal sleep” vs “Probability of Not having optimal sleep”

outcome.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Adequacy
outcome.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Sleep Adequacy sub-scale scores range from 0 to 100, higher scores indicate greater sleep adequacy.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Adequacy
measure.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Sleep Adequacy sub-scale scores range from 0 to 100, higher scores indicate greater sleep adequacy.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Overall Sleep Problems Index
outcome.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Overall Sleep Problems Index is a 9-item sub-scale; scores range from 0 to 100, lower scores indicate fewer sleep problems.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Overall Sleep Problems Index
measure.description: MOS Sleep Scale is a subject-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess the key constructs of sleep; assesses sleep for the 4 weeks prior to evaluation. The MOS Overall Sleep Problems Index is a 9-item sub-scale; scores range from 0 to 100, lower scores indicate fewer sleep problems.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. MOS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Euro Quality of Life (QOL) (EQ-5D) Utility Score
outcome.description: EQ-5D, a subject-completed questionnaire, assesses health-related QOL. QOL Health State Profile (HSP) is designed to record subject’s level of current health across 5 domains (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort & anxiety/depression); scores are used to calculate EQ-5D Utility Score; range: -0.594 to 1.000 (from worst to best).
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. EQ-5D was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Euro Quality of Life (QOL) (EQ-5D) Utility Score
measure.description: EQ-5D, a subject-completed questionnaire, assesses health-related QOL. QOL Health State Profile (HSP) is designed to record subject’s level of current health across 5 domains (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort & anxiety/depression); scores are used to calculate EQ-5D Utility Score; range: -0.594 to 1.000 (from worst to best).
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. EQ-5D was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Endpoint Utility Score Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Euro Quality of Life (EQ-5D) Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
outcome.description: EQ-5D is a subject-completed questionnaire to assess health-related QOL (Health State Profile (HSP) & Visual Analog Scale (VAS)). The VAS is designed to rate the subject’s current health state on a scale from 0 to 100 where 0 represents the worst imaginable health state and 100 represents the best imaginable health state.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. EQ-5D was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Euro Quality of Life (EQ-5D) Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
measure.description: EQ-5D is a subject-completed questionnaire to assess health-related QOL (Health State Profile (HSP) & Visual Analog Scale (VAS)). The VAS is designed to rate the subject’s current health state on a scale from 0 to 100 where 0 represents the worst imaginable health state and 100 represents the best imaginable health state.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. EQ-5D was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Endpoint VAS Score Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale- Anxiety (HADS-A) Score
outcome.description: HADS-A consists of 7 items that are assessed by a score of 0 = no anxiety to 3 = severe feeling of anxiety. The anxiety subscale determines a state of generalized anxiety (including anxious mood, restlessness, anxious thoughts, panic attacks). Score range = 0 to 21; higher scores indicate a greater intensity of anxiety
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. HADS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale- Anxiety (HADS-A) Score
measure.description: HADS-A consists of 7 items that are assessed by a score of 0 = no anxiety to 3 = severe feeling of anxiety. The anxiety subscale determines a state of generalized anxiety (including anxious mood, restlessness, anxious thoughts, panic attacks). Score range = 0 to 21; higher scores indicate a greater intensity of anxiety
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. HADS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Endpoint Anxiety Score Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale- Depression (HADS-D) Score
outcome.description: HADS-D consists of 7 items that are assessed by a score of 0 = no depression to 3 = severe feeling of depression. The depression subscale focuses on the state of lost interest and diminished pleasure response (“lowering of hedonic tone”). Score range = 0 to 21; higher scores indicate a greater intensity of depression
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. HADS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale- Depression (HADS-D) Score
measure.description: HADS-D consists of 7 items that are assessed by a score of 0 = no depression to 3 = severe feeling of depression. The depression subscale focuses on the state of lost interest and diminished pleasure response (“lowering of hedonic tone”). Score range = 0 to 21; higher scores indicate a greater intensity of depression
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. HADS was measured at baseline and Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Endpoint Depression Score Pregabalin minus Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Estimated from general linear model with treatment and center as factors and baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
outcome.description: PGIC is a subject-rated instrument that measured change in subject’s overall status on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improved = minimally improved, much improved, and very much improved; Worse = minimally worse, much worse, and very much worse.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. PGIC was measured at Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
measure.description: PGIC is a subject-rated instrument that measured change in subject’s overall status on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improved = minimally improved, much improved, and very much improved; Worse = minimally worse, much worse, and very much worse.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. PGIC was measured at Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) test on the null hypothesis of no treatment difference in all centers. CMH test comparing Pregabalin to Placebo adjusted for center.
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance. p-value is from comparing Pregabalin versus Placebo.
analysis.method_desc: To apply CMH, each category is given a numerical score; the method of "modified rdit" used to assign numeric scores.

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC)
outcome.description: CGIC is a clinician-rated instrument that assesses the subject’s overall global improvement on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improved = minimally improved, much improved, and very much improved; Worse = minimally worse, much worse, and very much worse.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. CGIC was measured at Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC)
measure.description: CGIC is a clinician-rated instrument that assesses the subject’s overall global improvement on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improved = minimally improved, much improved, and very much improved; Worse = minimally worse, much worse, and very much worse.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. CGIC was measured at Week 8. For subjects not completing the study, their final data were considered Week 8 data; those without final data were excluded from analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) test on the null hypothesis of no treatment difference in all centers. CMH test comparing Pregabalin to Placebo adjusted for center.
analysis.p_value_desc: All statistical testing was 2-sided and was conducted at the 5% level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: To apply CMH, each category is given a numerical score; the method of "modified rdit" used to assign numeric scores.

outcome.title: Duration Adjusted Average Change (DAAC) of (Unadjusted) Mean Pain Score
outcome.description: DAAC is a score used to assess treatment effects averaged over the entire length of the study. DAAC from baseline to weekly mean pain score was derived by calculating the mean of all post-baseline scores minus baseline mean pain score, and then weighing this according to the proportion of the planned study duration the subject actually completed.
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. For subjects who did not complete the study, the last 7 observations while on study medication were carried forward (LOCF).

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

measure.title: Duration Adjusted Average Change (DAAC) of (Unadjusted) Mean Pain Score
measure.description: DAAC is a score used to assess treatment effects averaged over the entire length of the study. DAAC from baseline to weekly mean pain score was derived by calculating the mean of all post-baseline scores minus baseline mean pain score, and then weighing this according to the proportion of the planned study duration the subject actually completed.
measure.population: The ITT population consisted of subjects who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had contributed to the analysis of any efficacy parameter. For subjects who did not complete the study, the last 7 observations while on study medication were carried forward (LOCF).

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose levels of pregabalin were 150 mg/day, 300 mg/day, 450 mg/day, and 600 mg/day which were achieved by taking 75 mg, 150 mg, 225 mg (which was the combination of 75 mg + 150 mg) or 300 mg of pregabalin twice daily (BID), with or without food, once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects who were randomized to placebo remained on placebo throughout the remainder of the study.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
